intro: Linaria dalmatica subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the Dalmatian toadflax, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are tubular with two lips, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
